title: Liu captures elusive figure skating gold for U.S.
content: Alysa Liu won the first women's figure skating gold medal for the United States in 24 years at the Winter Olympics in Milan on Thursday.

title: Golden goal: Keller, U.S. women top Canada in OT
content: Megan Keller scored the golden goal in 3-on-3 overtime as the United States women's hockey team won Olympic gold by beating archrival Canada 2-1.

title: Sources: NBA plans to enact anti-tanking rules
content: Commissioner Adam Silver informed the league's 30 general managers Thursday that the NBA plans to make anti-tanking rule changes for next season, sources told ESPN.

content: The city of Beverly Hills apologized to Celtics star Jaylen Brown on Thursday over inaccuracies in a previous statement, but Brown continued to take issue with the police shutting down his All-Star Weekend brand event.

title: 'Special': Cunningham makes MVP case vs. Knicks
content: The Pistons' Cade Cunningham made his case to be the NBA's Most Valuable Player, erupting for 42 points, 13 assists and eight rebounds in a decisive 126-111 win over the Knicks.

title: Porzingis rusty but provides spark in Dubs debut
content: Kristaps Porzingis, making his Warriors debut in his first game since Jan. 7, opened slow but made an impact in his 17 minutes, scoring 12 points in a 121-110 loss to the Celtics.

title: Sources: Brewers reward Murphy with new deal
content: The Brewers have given a new contract to two-time NL Manager of the Year Pat Murphy that makes him one of the highest-paid managers in MLB, sources told ESPN

title: How Alysa Liu became the unlikeliest Olympic figure skating champion
content: Alysa Liu won Olympic gold on Thursday -- an unexpected fairy-tale ending to an up-and-down week for the U.S. figure skating team.

content: The creator of the Hulu hit kept a diary of the live tour. He shares it ahead of the Season 5 U.S. debut.

content: The Cottage Grove Wolfpack emerged victorious Wednesday in a Minnesota U12 girls hockey postseason game that started Monday and ended Wednesday.

content: Arsenal's Premier League championship charge suffered yet another wobble on Wednesday, leaving many Gunners fans to wonder: "Is it happening again?"

title: No respite for World Cup fans affected by Trump travel restrictions
content: Members of the Haitian and Senegalese communities in the U.S. react to President Donald Trump's visa restrictions ahead of the World Cup.

title: Have F1’s regulations for 2026 made the sport too complicated?
content: F1's star drivers have spent much of preseason criticizing the sport's new-for-2026 cars. They might have a point, but there are no simple solutions.

title: Humility, charitable foundation keep Larry Fitzgerald grounded after HOF nod
content: "It's an amazing, amazing thing to be a Hall of Famer, but the light bill still came," Larry Fitzgerald said, keeping life in perspective.

content: With labor negotiations ahead, losing the union president is a shock. But the MLBPA has an opportunity to come out of this stronger.

content: Two fighters and two trainers share their analysis and predictions for the Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia title fight.

content: The champion Seahawks are among 11 teams whose win total opened at 10.5, the highest number on the board.

content: Indian team will be headed by chief negotiator Darpan Jain, who is a joint secretary in the Commerce Ministry

title: 19-year-old student beaten up by live-in partner admitted to AIIMS in critical condition
content: Police have arrested the accused partner, identified as Shivam (19), a resident of Delhi. The victim, a native of North Tripura, was a biotechnology student at GD Goenka University in Gurugram

title: 9 patients' eyes removed, 9 others lose vision after cataract surgery in Gorakhpur; hospital sealed
content: They said that within 24 hours of the surgeries, several patients began complaining of severe pain and discharge from the operated eye

title: In Pictures: Global Navies gather in Visakhapatnam for MILAN 2026
content: Visakhapatnam hosts a slate of major maritime events in February, bringing global navies to India’s east coast

title: Ailing 30-year-old female elephant undergoes treatment at Thalavadi
content: Farmers noticed the elephant lying in the field and alerted the Thalavadi Range Office under the Hasanur Forest Division

title: Journalists protest restrictions at Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru
content: Media personnel expressed objection to the circular that mandates journalists to obtain official video statements only at a designated location near the western gate of Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru

title: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio to visit India ‘very soon’, Envoy Sergio Gor says
content: The U.S. Envoy to India did not specify dates of the visit, but said it is scheduled in the next few months

title: Kannur ADM Naveen Babu death: Prosecution tells court no need for further probe
content: Prosecution opposes petition by Naveen Babu’s wife seeking fresh probe, says issues raised in plea had been examined and rejected by courts from Magistrate level up to Supreme Court

title: Environmentalists oppose construction of stadium on KSIC filature factory premises in T. Narasipura in Karnataka
content: Parisarakkagi Naavu, an environment protection organization, pointed out that the land in T. Narsipura earmarked for construction of a stadium contains more than 500 trees of various species, many of which are over a hundred years old

title: Chhatrasal Stadium murder case: Delhi HC seeks police's stand on wrestler Sushil Kumar's bail plea
content: The court issued notice to Delhi Police and the kin of the deceased, and asked them to file a status report and a reply, respectively.

title: Bengaluru’s Indian Cartoon Gallery and its role in documenting this art form
content: As the Indian Cartoon Gallery enters into its 20th year, we take a look at how it began and its workings

title: Mumbai Climate Week 2026: Bela Gram emerges as Maharashtra’s first net-zero village through panchayat leadership
content: “Climate action begins at home, when the Panchayat guides, people participate, and change starts,” say Sarpanch of Bela Gram

title: New terminal of Guwahati airport to begin operations from Feb. 22, says Assam CM
content: Domestic and international flights are likely to operate from the new terminal by March, while the old terminal will be converted into a cargo hub

title: Supreme Court rejects plea for ban on naming mosques after Babur
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta rejected a plea by Devki Nandan Pandey, who sought a blanket judicial restraint on naming mosques after Babur or using the nomenclature ‘Babri Masjid’

title: Kerala SIR: State has a little over 2.69 crore voters in final list
content: Kerala’s final electoral roll to be formally published on February 21. The ECI list will have a little over 16.54 lakh voters less than the voters’ list used for local body elections in December 2025

title: Tension grips Belagavi village after Sangolli Rayanna statue desecrated
content: Black ink was found smeared on the statue, following which the village youth raised slogans in protest.

title: People eager for political change in Kerala, UDF will come to power with 100 seats: Ramesh Chennithala
content: Congress leader says Chief Minister’s ‘anxiety over impending electoral setback is the reason behind blatant misuse of government machinery and officials’ for proposed Nava Kerala survey

title: Sachin Pilot demands transparent probe into Ajit Pawar’s death
content: The Congress leader, who lost his father in a vehicular accident, emphasised that such incidents transcend political lines and necessitate a thorough investigation to uncover the facts.

title: Priyanka Gandhi criticises Assam CM for dragging Gaurav Gogoi’s family, children into ‘Pakistan link’ allegation
content: After paying homage to Zubeen Garg at his cremation ground 'Zubeen Khetra' at Sonapur, the Congress leader said the singer was "above politics" and spread the message of love throughout his life

title: SIR hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to hear pleas challenging the EC's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in West Bengal
content: The Supreme Court also asked West Bengal to respond to allegations of violence committed against EC officials

title: Defamation case against Rahul Gandhi: U.P. court fixes March 9 as next date of hearing
content: The case dates back to 2018 when local BJP leader Vijay Mishra had filed a defamation complaint against Mr. Gandhi

title: PM Modi's vision of AI would enable ethical, inclusive and accountable innovation: Yogi Adityanath
content: The chief minister highlighted ongoing efforts and achievements of Uttar Pradesh in the field of AI.

title: Surgical instrument found in Kerala woman’s abdomen 5 years after surgery
content: Health Minister orders inquiry. The woman, seeking treatment for abdominal pain, was found to have an artery forceps in her after an X-ray

title: Madras HC orders registration of case on cash-for-jobs complaint in T.N. Minister K.N. Nehru’s Municipal Administration Department
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan issue the direction on a writ petition filed by AIADMK MP I.S. Inbadurai

title: India signs agreement to join U.S.-led coalition Pax Silica
content: The move comes amid efforts by the two sides to finalise the proposed trade deal and move forward on several other initiatives to solidify the bilateral ties

title: Great Backyard Bird Count 2026: North Coastal Andhra posts strong species tally
content: Citizen observers across Visakhapatnam, Vizianagaram and Srikakulam document wetlands, campuses and estuaries during the four-day bird census

title: ‘Toxic’ teaser: Yash shows grand machismo in Geetu Mohandas’ stylistic actioner
content: Directed by Geetu Mohandas and co-produced by Yash, ‘Toxic’ hits theaters on March 19, 2025, right in the ring with the blockbuster sequel Dhurandhar 2, featuring Ranveer Singh

title: IT Minister Priyank Kharge meets Anthropic team, indicates Karnataka to work closely with AI firm
content: The interaction covered Anthropic’s plans for its Bengaluru office and opportunities to work closely with Karnataka’s technology and startup ecosystem

title: Gram panchayat member caught taking ₹1.7 lakh bribe in Thane district
content: According to the ACB, the complainant had constructed a three-story building after securing all necessary permissions. He applied to the gram panchayat in October 2025 for the assessment and levy of property and water taxes for the building

title: By donating organs to others, deceased Kerala baby now immortal: Jharkhand CM
content: Hemant Soren said that his government would take all steps to strengthen the State's organ donation policy

title: Mild tension at Amberpet during Shivaji Jayanti procession
content: The incident was reported after 10 p.m. when a group taking part in the procession allegedly shouted slogans in front of the Jamia Masjid while prayers were being conducted inside

title: A tribal hamlet’s tryst with AI-assisted tools
content: In the remote hills of Kumram Bheem Asifabad district, Limbuguda — home to less than 40 Kolam families — is witnessing a quiet transformation. A state-of-the-art Multipurpose Centre, established under the PM-JANMAN scheme, is leveraging AI-assisted learning tools to improve education, alongside healthcare and nutrition services, reshaping aspirations in one of Telangana’s most marginalised PVTG habitations

title: ‘Fireman’ to ‘Firefighter’: Karnataka to introduce 10% quota for women in recruitment
content: The decision follows directions issued during a meeting of the Union Ministry of Home Affairs to encourage greater participation of women in fire services across the country

title: Sandalwood: An expensive fragrance
content: India was the world’s leading producer of sandalwood until the last century, but it was displaced by Australia. What led to this fall, and what does the recent Union Budget’s offering to collaborate with States to revive the sandalwood industry in India mean for farmers? Chetan B.C. explores.

title: Cough syrup-linked deaths: Do you realise what dent it caused to country's image, Supreme Court asks pharma firm
content: The order summoned the firm and some of its officials on a complaint alleging various violations, including the manufacture and sale of drugs declared "not of standard quality"

title: Jammu and Kashmir’s Kishtwar admn. calls for regulation of Ramzan charity, evokes criticism from NC, PDP
content: Pankaj Kumar Sharma, DC of Kishtwar, in the order expressed fears that “during the holy month of Ramadan, there is a tendency for unregulated and unauthorized collection of donations, which necessitates immediate regulatory intervention”

title: Reassessing Periyar E.V. Ramasamy’s take on Tamil, which he called a barbarian language
content: The Dravidar Kazhagam founder believed that Tamil lacked sufficient literature that would pave the way for human development and cultivation of scientific temper. ‘It is my anguish that Tamil could not become a language of science and rationalism like English,’ he wrote while defending his characterisation of the language

title: J. Sivashanmugam Pillai: a tall leader of Tamil Nadu belonging to what was once known Depressed Classes
content: J. Sivashanmugam Pillai was the first Scheduled Caste member to become the Tamil Nadu Assembly Speaker in 1946. He was known for impartiality, with former CM Kamaraj saying, ‘Though a Congressman, he held the scales even.’ He demitted the office in 1955 to become Member of the UPSC and was elected to the Rajya Sabha in 1962

title: Udhagamandalam’s own Charing Cross and its London disconnect
content: It has long been the entrance to the headquarters of The Nilgiris district. It shares its name with a junction in Westminster, London, where six routes meet. Hence, many believe that the Charing Cross in Udhagamandalam is modelled on the one in London

title: A temporary relief from bonded labour
content: A landmark law formulated to end bonded labour in India marks its 50th year of passing. Satyasundar Barik examines the Act’s relevance and effectiveness through the voices of labourers in Odisha who slipped back into bondage even after being officially rescued

title: 15,849 vehicles with same chassis, engine number registered in multiple Northeast States: CAG
content: The latest audit report flagged contract carriage permits for school buses in Assam, resulting in the bypassing of mandatory fitness tests

title: Petitions filed in Patna High Court challenging election of several MLAs, court issues notices
content: The petitions have been filed by the candidates who lost the election from their respective constituencies

title: Trump repeats claim he ended conflict between India and Pakistan; said he threatened 200% tariffs on countries
content: Donald Trump repeated the claim that he stopped eight wars within the first year of his second term in the White House as he addressed an event of the Board of Peace in Washington

title: Post-viral prolonged cough a cause for concern, say medical experts
content: While hospitals in Ernakulam have not reported a spike in viral infections and post-viral cough cases, patients have been seeking treatment for prolonged cough

title: T.N. govt. puts off plan to provide separate scribes to students for public exams
content: Sources in the department said the decision was made after backlash from disability rights organisations regarding the short time available to implement the announcement

title: Travel operators seek road tax relief, rollback of 3% cess in pre-Budget memorandum
content: To help achieve the targets under the Tourism Policy 2024–29, the association sought tax exemptions or reductions for tourist vehicles, including mini buses, multi-utility vehicles

title: India attends Trump's Board of Peace meeting as observer nation
content: India has not joined the Board of Peace, which has been set up by Mr. Trump for the redevelopment of the Gaza Strip

title: Heritage Dairy never compromised on quality, says Bhuvaneswari
content: Each one of the products reaches the customers only after passing 25 quality tests, says its Vice-Chairperson and Managing Director

title: Ponniyathangam festival draws crowds, praise from Chief Minister
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan spends over half an hour watching high-energy Kalaripayattu performances at the Ponniyathangam festival, praising its growing public appeal. The event features martial arts displays, cultural competitions and musical performances, drawing enthusiastic crowds and participants from across the country.

title: Indian Americans largely disapprove of Trump’s first year job performance, but Democrats do not benefit: Survey
content: Broken down by policy areas, the disapproval rates are 64% for immigration policies, 68% for domestic economic policy and 70% for international economic policy (trade, tariffs, sanctions)

title: Kerala Minister Sivankutty launches State-level construction of model autism centres
content: Minister says autism complexes intended to prioritise individual learning and therapy of differently abled

title: Green protocol to be tightened for Attukal Pongala fete
content: District Collector Anu Kumari releases brochure of ‘Bhakthikku Vritthi Mukhyam’ mega campaign prepared by disrict Suchitwa Mission

title: Anil Ambani assures Supreme Court he has no plans or intention to leave the country
content: Anil Ambani files affidavit saying he will appear before ED on February 26 and fully cooperate with the probe into an alleged bank fraud case, will not leave India without prior permission from the court

title: Shillong MP Ricky Andrew J. Syngkon passes away
content: The 54-year-old Ricky Andrew J. Syngkon, who represented the Voice of the People Party, suffered a cardiac arrest; he reportedly collapsed while playing football in Mawiong on the outskirts of Meghalaya’s capital

title: Lokesh tells officials to focus on job creation for youths in A.P.
content: Officials instructed to include the notification for faculty posts in State universities and government degree colleges in Ugadi Job Calendar

title: Uttar Pradesh Congress leaders push for mass FIRs against Assam CM for ‘communal’ statements
content: Congress leader Shahnawaz Alam has urged the judiciary to take suo motu cognisance of the statements and initiate action against Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Referring to Ramakrishna Paramahamsa as ‘swami’ reflects insensitivity, Mamata reacts to PM’s social media post
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi “not to discover new prefixes and suffixes for the great Renaissance figures of Bengal who shaped modern India”

title: Bangladeshi fugitive wanted for murder of police officer deported
content: Government officials identified the man as Ahmed Raza Hasan Mehdi, who was intercepted by immigration authorities while he was attempting to board a flight to a European destination

title: Attacking doctors, raising wild allegation of medical negligence unacceptable: KGMOA
content: KGMOA observes protest day at Nedumangad hospital by suspending all services except emergency care. They will launch indefinite non-cooperation strike on Friday, abstaining from all duties other than patient care

title: Supreme Court Dismisses Plea That Sought Ban On Naming Mosques After Babur
content: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea that sought a ban on the construction or naming of any mosque or religious structure in the name of Mughal emperor Babur or Babri Masjid.

title: Opinion: Opinion | In Bangladesh, A Story Of Many Wins
content: The rain is over, and the clouds are clearing. Now, the hard work of rebuilding a nation begins, and India must be standing right there alongside as a friend.

title: Man Accidentally Throws Away Gold Worth Rs 15 Lakh. Scrap Dealer Returns It
content: Haji Akhtar Khan, a scrap dealer from Faridabad, was going through junk at his shop when he found 100 grams of gold jewellery valued at over Rs 15 lakh. It was like a lottery ticket he had never purchased but still won.

title: '200% Tariff, 11 Jets Down': Trump's Latest On India-Pak Ceasefire
content: US President Donald Trump reiterated his claim that he mediated between India and Pakistan during the 2025 military standoff, claiming he had threatened to put 200 per cent tariffs on the two nuclear-armed neighbours if they didn't stop the fighting.

title: French President Macron's 'Thank You' Note To India With 'Dhurandhar' Track
content: French President Emmanuel Macron shared the glimpses from his trip in a 43-second montage, with the song 'Na De Dil Pardesi Nu' from the Hindi blockbuster 'Dhurandhar' playing in the background.

title: "Epstein Told Me His Darkest Secrets": Survivor Recalls Once-Silenced Horror To NDTV
content: Rina Oh, who was 21 at the time, told NDTV that Jeffrey Epstein "psychologically harmed" her by insulting and criticising her body.

title: 36 km In 8 Minutes, No Runway, No Fuel: India To Get First Air Taxi Soon
content: Developed by The E Plane Company in collaboration with IIT Madras, the electric Vertical Take-Off and Landing (e-VTOL) aircraft is designed to cut travel time in congested cities.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Paradox Of India's 'YOLO' Consumer
content: The higher weightage for personal care, transport and intoxicants draws the picture of a consumer with a YOLO (you-only-live-once) approach.

title: UP Man Wakes Up Brother To Get Him Tea, Kills Him With Axe As He Argues
content: A few days later, in an effort to hide the crime, the accused filed a missing person report at a nearby police station for his brother.

title: Epstein Files Detail Ex-UK Prince Andrew's Confidential Briefs, Oil Deals
content: King Charles' younger brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested on Thursday on suspicion of misconduct in public office over allegations that he sent confidential government documents to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 12 More Questions Opposition Asked In Parliament To Hold Centre Accountable
content: Last week, your columnist chose 12 questions from among the 4500 questions asked in the first half of the Budget Session. 2750 questions in Lok Sabha, 1760 questions in Rajya Sabha, were balloted to be asked during Question Hour.

title: What Is Pax Silica, The US-Led AI And Supply Chain Strategic Alliance India Joined
content: India's decision to join Pax Silica comes days after a trade deal with the US following a period of tensions over tariffs put in place by Donald Trump.

title: Thane Girl Injured In 2016 Accident Gets Rs 25-Lakh Compensation
content: The Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) in Thane has awarded a compensation of Rs 25.2 lakh to a girl who suffered permanent physical disabilities in an accident nearly a decade ago, noting that she had a "bright future".

title: "King Experienced But...": BJP's Maithili Thakur's 'Dhritarashtra' Jibe At Lalu Yadav
content: In a fiery speech inside the Bihar assembly, Maithili Thakur also compared Lalu Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav to 'Duryodhana'.

title: Uninterrupted Solar Power, Free Cooling: India's Data Centres May Soon Go Orbital
content: This year, Indian start-ups are preparing to try. On a rocket that has never reached orbit before, Chennai-based Agnikul Cosmos is attempting a radical first, transforming the last stage of its Agnibaan rocket into a functioning data centre in space.

title: US State Sues Apple Over Alleged Use Of ICloud For Storing Child Sex Abuse Material
content: The US state of West Virginia on Thursday said it is suing Apple over child sex abuse material people tuck away in its iCloud online storage service.

title: UK Ex-Prince Andrew's Arrest Puts Spotlight On Lord Mountbatten Abuse Claims
content: The arrest of former British royal Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor now also put the spotlight on Andrew's great-uncle, and India's last Viceroy, Lord Mountbatten, who was accused of sexually abusing young boys in the Kincora Boys' Home scandal.

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026 Day 5 Live Updates: Pax Silica Ensures Supply Chains Are Safe, Secure: Sundar Pichai At AI Summit
content: AI Impact Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: The day is headlined by the GPAI Council Meeting, where member nations of the Global Partnership on Artificial Intelligence review progress on responsible and inclusive technology.

title: India May Join Pax Silica Next Month: All About The US-Led Initiative
content: India is poised to become a full member of the US-led strategic group Pax Silica, with a formal invitation expected next month, US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor revealed during his visit to New Delhi.

title: AI To Starlink: How Drone Technology Transformed Battlefield In Ukraine
content: As the war in Ukraine drags into its fifth year, drones have come to completely dominate the front line -- a transformation in modern warfare that is being watched around the world.

title: How Premier League clubs look to U.S. to fund big-money signings
content: Gab Marcotti looks at the reasons why premier league clubs were able to pass the £3 billion mark in transfer spending in the summer window . from next season, the league will switch from Profit and Sustainability Rules (PSR) to Squad Cost Ratio (SCR) regulations, marking the latest shift in english soccer's financial landscape .

title: 'Mother died due to her': How techie plotted pregnant ex-wife's murder in Hyderabad
content: A pregnant woman was brutally murdered by her ex-husband in Hyderabad, a crime meticulously planned weeks in advance. The accused tracked her movements, procured weapons including a chainsaw, and intended to break into her home. He harbored a grudge over their divorce and her remarriage, having previously faced a domestic violence case.

title: Pakistan says Imran Khan rejected 'serious deals' twice for release from jail
content: A top aide to Pakistan's PM claims Imran Khan rejected two "serious" release deals, one involving a former KP chief minister and another from abroad. The government denies any leniency, calling Khan a "convicted criminal" amid concerns over his deteriorating eyesight in prison.

title: Trump loved his visit to India, told me the culture is unmatched: US envoy Sergio Gor
content: US Ambassador Sergio Gor hinted at an upcoming meeting between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump, emphasizing growing AI and semiconductor cooperation. India's signing of the Pax Silica Declaration, alongside US officials, signifies a pivotal moment for bilateral ties, fostering collaboration in advanced technologies among trusted nations.

title: Stones hurled at Vande Bharat in UP's Hardoi; RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on board
content: A Vande Bharat train carrying RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat was stoned near Kauda village in Uttar Pradesh, cracking a windowpane. Police are investigating, with preliminary reports suggesting children playing cricket may have been involved. This incident follows meetings between Bhagwat and Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and Deputy Chief Ministers, sparking political discussions ahead of state elections.

title: Record-breaking reach! India-Pakistan clash becomes T20 World Cup's most-viewed match
content: India's dominant T20 World Cup victory over Pakistan shattered digital records, attracting 163 million viewers, the highest ever for an ICC T20 World Cup match. Ishan Kishan's explosive 77 powered India to 175/7, a target Pakistan couldn't chase, falling for 114. This win secured India's Super Eight spot unbeaten.

title: Who is Ranvir Sachdeva, youngest speaker at India AI Summit
content: An eight-year-old technologist, Ranvir Sachdeva, is the youngest keynote speaker at the India AI Impact Summit 2026. He is discussing how ancient Indian philosophies connect with modern AI. Ranvir is also sharing his contributions to India's GDP and AI literacy through an Indian AI model. He has previously met global tech leaders and the UN Secretary-General.

title: 'Stay in own lane': Macron tells Italian PM Meloni to 'stop commenting on other countries'
content: French President Emmanuel Macron criticized Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni for commenting on French affairs after she condemned the killing of a far-right activist. Macron urged leaders to "stay in their own lane," emphasizing that violence has no place in France. Meloni, in turn, expressed surprise at Macron's reaction, stating her comments were about the risks of polarization, not interference.

title: 'I went looking for a ghost' but found something more haunting
content: A traveler recounts an eerie visit to George Everest House in Mussoorie, a place steeped in local legends of paranormal activity.  Initially seeking thrills, the author discovers the true 'haunting' is the profound grief of a local man who visits daily, a poignant reminder of loss amidst the mountain's silent beauty.

title: After CEO's 'exit' warning, Accenture now has an 'AI rule' for promotions
content: Accenture is tying senior staff promotions to AI tool usage, requiring "regular adoption" as a criterion for leadership roles. The consulting giant is also tracking individual weekly logins to its AI tools. The move follows CEO Julie Sweet's earlier warning that non-adapters would be "exited." Internally, some employees have pushed back, calling the tools "broken slop generators." The policy comes as Accenture's share price has fallen roughly 42% over the past year.

title: 'He would have fetched at least 20 cr': Ex-India cricketer bold remark for star fast bowler
content: Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif stated Blessing Muzarabani's current form could have secured him bids exceeding ₹20 crore in the IPL 2026 auction. Kaif suggested the auction timing was unfortunate for the Zimbabwean bowler. Muzarabani's impressive performance in the T20 World Cup, including key wickets against Australia and Sri Lanka, highlighted his potential.

title: Umpire dies in bee attack during Cricket match in Uttar Pradesh
content: A senior umpire, Manik Gupta, has died after a bee swarm attacked a cricket match in Shuklaganj Unnao. Gupta, 65, was stung multiple times during a KDMA league game. He was taken to several hospitals before being declared dead. Gupta had served on the KCA umpiring panel for 30 years.

title: 'Can't blame everything on...': OpenAI CEO calls out tech firms for mass layoffs
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman criticizes companies for 'AI washing' – falsely blaming AI for layoffs driven by cost-cutting. While genuine job displacement by AI is coming, many firms use it as a narrative shield for over-hiring or restructuring. High-profile companies have even walked back AI-centric layoff claims, revealing more mundane reasons.

title: India-US sign Pax Silica Declaration: New Delhi’s entry ‘strategic and essential’
content: India has joined the US-led Pax Silica strategic alliance, a coalition aimed at defining the 21st-century economic and technological order. The declaration focuses on building secure, resilient ecosystems for critical minerals and AI, bolstering India's electronics and semiconductor industry. This move strengthens global AI and semiconductor supply chains, reducing dependence on non-aligned nations.

title: Inside the MQ-9 Reaper: How America’s armed drones reshape regional security
content: The US is expanding its MQ-9 Reaper drone deployments across the Indo-Pacific, creating a robust surveillance and strike network. These long-endurance aircraft enhance intelligence gathering and precision strikes, with allies increasingly acquiring the platform to bolster regional interoperability and information sharing.

title: Told not to smoke while refuelling, man sets petrol pump ablaze — watch
content: A shocking incident unfolded at a Raipur petrol pump when a man, angered by being told not to smoke, allegedly ignited a fuel nozzle with a lighter. Flames engulfed a motorcycle and the pump, causing panic. Alert staff quickly extinguished the fire using an extinguisher, averting a major disaster. Both accused were apprehended and arrested by the police.

title: Rajinikanth’s Poes Garden home: Inside the quiet, minimal world of a living legend
content: Venture into the tranquil home of Rajinikanth, the legendary superstar, where his Poes Garden bungalow radiates simplicity and grace. Priced at Rs 35 crore, the space boasts understated interiors featuring rich wood detailing and soothing neutral colors, echoing the essence of his humble spirit.

title: 'India won't make it to semi-finals': Former Pakistan pacer's shocking take
content: Former Pakistan bowler Mohammad Amir has made bold predictions for the T20 World Cup 2026. He believes India will not advance to the semi-finals. Amir points to India's batting collapses in recent matches. He suggests teams like South Africa and the West Indies can exploit these weaknesses. India faces South Africa in their Super 8 opener.

title: Missing teen's head found hanging from tree in Varanasi forest
content: A grim discovery was made in Sonbhadra district as a teenager's head was found hanging from a tree in a forest. The 16-year-old, missing since January 19th, was identified by his brother. Authorities are investigating the case, with initial assessments suggesting the remains are several weeks old. The incident has sent shockwaves through the local community.

title: 'With so many left-handers, finger spin is the problem': India coach sounds alarm before Super 8
content: Despite an unbeaten league stage, India faces challenges with catching and batting against spin, particularly off-spinners. The presence of multiple left-handers and Abhishek Sharma's form are key concerns. Teams are targeting this weakness, and India needs a clear game plan for upcoming Super 8 matches against spin-heavy opponents.

title: 'Phone shows time': UP govt cites SC ruling to prohibit loudspeakers during night for Ramzan
content: Uttar Pradesh government has upheld Supreme Court directives on loudspeaker usage, denying requests for mosque announcements during Ramzan.  While Samajwadi Party members argued for 'sehri' and 'iftar' calls, the state cited the 10 pm to 6 am sound restriction.  Officials stated mobile phones make traditional time announcements unnecessary, emphasizing adherence to judicial orders over religious practices.

title: 'Drishyam 3' plot leaked? Fans decode cryptic story clues
content: Anticipation for 'Drishyam 3' is soaring as a leaked plot summary reveals Georgekutty now battles internal demons alongside external threats.  The thriller delves into the psychological toll of his secret, with new forces closing in.  Fans speculate about family revelations and the fate of a crucial memory card, promising an intense installment.

title: 'Toxic' teaser: Yash unveils fierce new avatar; set for box office clash with Dhurandhar
content: Rocking Star Yash returns in the gangster thriller 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups,' with a gripping teaser showcasing intense action and a fierce protagonist. Set in Goa between the 1940s and 70s, the film explores crime syndicates and betrayal. Co-written by Yash and directed by Geetu Mohandas, it features a stellar cast and releases March 19, clashing with 'Dhurandhar'.

title: ‘Chasing shadow in room of mirrors’: Why Delhi Police can’t crack the school bomb threat puzzle
content: Delhi Police face a significant challenge in curbing bomb hoaxes targeting schools, with perpetrators using VPNs and privacy-focused services to mask their origins. Investigations often lead to dead ends due to encrypted tunnels, no-log policies of VPN providers, and international privacy laws, leaving authorities in a reactive loop.

title: Hack of the day: Speak to anyone in India in their own language
content: India's Bhashini app breaks down language barriers. Travelers and businesses can now communicate seamlessly. The app offers real-time voice translation across over 22 Indian languages. Simply speak in your language, and it's instantly understood in another. This government-developed tool makes conversations effortless, connecting people across diverse linguistic regions.

title: 'Out of his limits': Shadab reprimanded by PCB over swipe at Ex-Pakistan legends
content: Pakistan Cricket Board has reportedly cautioned all-rounder Shadab Khan over his sharp remarks towards former players.  Following a match-winning performance, Shadab questioned the achievements of ex-cricketers, prompting a stern warning from team management.  The PCB emphasized respect for all former greats, including his father-in-law Saqlain Mushtaq, and has directed players to maintain decorum in public statements.

title: Bishnoi gang asks actor Ranveer Singh for Rs 10 crore; number belongs to US
content: Bollywood heartthrob Ranveer Singh is grappling with a serious threat after an audacious Rs 10 crore extortion message reached him via WhatsApp. The voice note, purportedly sent by Harry Boxer—an individual tied to the infamous Lawrence Bishnoi gang—has prompted the Mumbai Police to boost the actor's protection. Read on to know more in detail.

title: 'Great son of India': UK deputy PM David Lammy, Rishi Sunak trade stories of their Indian heritage
content: UK Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy lauded former PM Rishi Sunak as a "great son of India" during a New Delhi event, also highlighting his own Indian heritage. Lammy emphasized their ability to collaborate across political divides, particularly on prostate cancer initiatives.

title: 'Play like Vaibhav Sooryavanshi': Ashwin's bold take as India march into Super 8
content: India has advanced to the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup, showcasing strong collective effort despite not always being at their fluent best. Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted the team's batting depth and the crucial bowling spells from Varun Chakaravarthy and Jasprit Bumrah.  The article also notes other teams qualifying for the Super 8s and the 2028 World Cup.

title: From ambassadors to CEOs: The high-profile resignations tied to new Epstein files — check full list
content: New documents from Jeffrey Epstein's files are causing a stir. These papers detail years of communication linking the disgraced financier to powerful individuals worldwide. While Europe has seen swift consequences like resignations and investigations, the United States has experienced a more subdued reaction. Several prominent figures are facing scrutiny and uncomfortable questions following these disclosures.

title: New labour codes: From layoff guidelines to timely wages; checklist issued for employers
content: The Labour Ministry has unveiled a comprehensive compliance checklist for employers, consolidating nearly two dozen requirements under four new labour codes. This initiative aims to clarify responsibilities, prevent evasion, and minimize legal disputes by providing a clear roadmap for businesses.  The checklist covers foundational, monthly, annual, and event-specific obligations, ensuring smoother transitions and enhanced worker welfare.

title: UAE President orders nationwide release of 1,440 inmates to mark Ramadan 2026
content: In a significant gesture marking Ramadan's start, the UAE President has ordered the release of 1,440 inmates nationwide, also settling their financial penalties. This humanitarian initiative aims to offer a fresh start and support families. Similar releases were announced in Ajman (134 inmates) and Fujairah (125 inmates), with Fujairah's selection based on good conduct.

title: 'My girl lay soaked in blood': 6-year-old dies in hit-and-run in Delhi
content: A tragic collision in Janakpuri, Delhi, claimed the life of a six-year-old girl and injured her grandmother when their e-rickshaw was hit by a speeding car. The grandmother recounted the harrowing incident, highlighting the lack of immediate assistance. Police have registered a case and apprehended the accused driver, with investigations ongoing.

title: '11 jets shot down': Trump says '200% tariffs' threat forced India, Pak to stop fighting
content: Donald Trump claimed he averted war between India and Pakistan in May 2025 by threatening a 200% tariff on both nations. Speaking at his "Board of Peace" event, Trump cited Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif as validating his mediation efforts. India, however, has distanced itself from these claims, with Prime Minister Modi stating no foreign power mediated the situation.

title: Lewis University moves classes online after ICE leases space in same building
content: Lewis University is moving some classes online at its Oak Brook location due to ICE's presence in the same building. The university cited concerns about potential protests and community worries, aiming to ensure a safe learning environment. This precautionary measure will be in effect from February 16th to 21st.

title: India attends Donald Trump's inaugural Gaza Peace Board meeting as observer
content: India attended the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace on Gaza as an observer. The US committed $10 billion to the board, which aims for redevelopment and lasting peace in Gaza, though India has not joined as a member.

title: Stone-pelting at Durga temple triggers clashes in MP's Sehora
content: Tension erupted in Jabalpur's Sihora area late Thursday night after a youth allegedly vandalized a Durga temple's grills. The incident led to clashes and stone-pelting between two groups during Aarti and namaz. Police intervened, deploying heavy forces and lobbing tear gas shells to restore order.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 82,500
content: Stock market today: Equity benchmarks opened flat on Friday after a crash on Thursday due to escalating geopolitical tensions. While Nifty50 was above 25,450, BSE Sensex was near 82,500.

title: 'India haven't been challenged yet': Virender Sehwag fires Super 8 warning
content: Former India opener Virender Sehwag expressed concerns about India's bowling strength ahead of the Super 8s, despite their dominant group stage. He highlighted that the bowling unit hasn't been truly tested, citing the Netherlands match where runs were conceded.  Mohit Sharma also questioned the death bowling combination, emphasizing the need for clarity against stronger opponents.

title: Why the U.S. women won 2026 Olympic gold over Canada -- and an updated state of the rivalry
content: the 2026 Olympic women's hockey tournament ended in as epic a fashion as anyone could have imagined . the united states tied the score with just over two minutes remaining to send the game to overtime on a goal by Hilary Knight . but how did the game play out for both sides? who was the player of the game?

title: One proposal fixes the NBA’s tanking problem: Turning losses into wins
content: the Indiana Pacers are in the nation's capital to face the Washington Wizards . it's a game that should be compelling . Ivica Zubac , Indiana's recently acquired starting center, has yet to play for the club . he remains out with an ankle injury .

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S. men's hockey faces Slovakia in semis and more
content: no. 3 seed dominated germany 6-2 to advance to the men's freeski halfpipe final . team USA will face Slovakia in the semifinals after hanging on to defeat Sweden in overtime on Wednesday . americans Nick Goepper and Alex Ferreira will compete for gold .

title: Roundup: Liu claims skating gold after USA women's hockey glory
content: alysa Liu wins the first gold medal for an american in women's figure skating in 20 years . the silver goes to Kaori Sakamoto and bronze to mone Chiba, both of japan . it's the third Olympic gold for the U.S. in men's hockey .

title: The future is bright for Olympic gold medal winning U.S. women's hockey
content: the 2026 women's hockey team is the best team she's ever played on . a hockey hall of famer captained the last team to win a gold medal . "this is the most dominant team I've ever seen," duggan says .

title: Top moments: United States wins gold medal game over Canada in overtime
content: Emily Kaplan looks ahead to the U.S. women's hockey team's gold medal game against Canada. (0:43) It all came down to this at the 2026 Olympic Games for the two most dominant countries in international women's hockey. The United States and Canada faced off Thursday for the gold medal. After a thrilling back-and-forth game, the U.S. won 2-1 in overtime on a goal by Megan Keller. Women's ice hockey was first introduced at the Olympics in 1998, and these are the only two countries to have won Olympic gold since. Canada won gold four years ago in Beijing, but the U.S. swept this winter's Rivalry Series and defeated Canada 5-0 in the preliminary round. More:   U.S.-Canada is the rematch everyone wanted   |  U.S. favored in gold medal game Here are all the goals and top moments from the game.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Auburn's fortunes continue to slide after another loss
content: teams have roughly four weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate teams' underlying potential .

title: 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria' star Eric Dane passes away at 53 after battle with ALS
content: Beloved actor Eric Dane, celebrated for his roles in 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria', has passed away at 53. Dane bravely battled ALS, becoming a vocal advocate for awareness and research. He spent his final moments with his wife and daughters, leaving behind a legacy of passion and gratitude for his fans. His fight against the disease inspired many.
